generalInfo:
Egypt is a thrilling destination with unforgettable encounters of breath-taking ancient relics ,legendary Giza Pyramids and the Sphinx, and also the world-famous Egyptian Museum.

Follow the path of the river Nile as you marvel at Egypt's history, beauty and the unmatched experience of seeing amongst others - Philae Temple; Kom Ombo Temple, Edfu Temple, Valley of the Kings. A truly unforgettable experience is to see the Pyramid complex, golden treasures of Tutankhamun on display in the museum, the hustle and bustle of the streets and the eerie magic of the River Nile. Cairo is a vibrant, exhilarating and welcoming city. Home to the best Pharaonic, Coptic and Islamic sights in Egypt.

This is a private tour so you are looked after from the moment you land until departure.

Female guide available upon request.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival at Cairo International Airport, our representative welcomes and assists you through the immigration process. We can assist to issue Egypt entry visa upon arrival to Cairo. Transfer from Cairo airport to hotel by a deluxe A/C car for check in & refreshment. Overnight at the hotel in Cairo.

Enjoy a guided tour to visit one of the Seven Wonders The great Pyramids and Sphinx of Giza; Memphis: The oldest capital of Egypt, Sakkara: Is the oldest Ancient Egyptian cemetery. Drive back to your hotel in Cairo for refreshment. Overnight at the hotel in Cairo

Transfer to Alexandria via the desert road –about 225 km– whereby you will start a guided tour to visit the Bombay’s’ pillars, the Catacombs and Roman Amphitheatre. Passing by Alexandrina Bibliotheca & overview Qaite Bay citadel from outside. Pompeii Column and Kom el-Shuqafa Catacombs Thirty meters high and built from Aswan pink granite, the Pompeii Column is thought to have been a present from the people of Alexandria to Emperor Diocletian. Drive back to Cairo, to your hotel for refreshment. Overnight at the hotel in Cairo

Guided tour to visit the Citadel & Mohamed Ali Mosque. You will be escorted to a fascinating maze of little streets, filled with numerous old monuments and mosques from Cairo's Islamic past. Saladin's Citadel, the impressive 19th century Mosque of Mohammed Ali, and considered the oldest university in the world. Continue the tour to visit the Egyptian Museum. The museum exhibited collections ranges from pre-historic era to the Greco Roman period. It has 107 halls, and the ground floor houses huge statues. The museum also comprises of a photography section and large library. After the visit a short drive will take you to Khan El Khalili bazaars; which is one of the most famous worldwide with its amazing narrow alleyways. The bazaar is the domain of shopkeepers and tourists. Jewelers, items made from copper, parquetry boxes, semi-precious stones, rugs, and other souvenirs. Drive back to your hotel in Cairo for refreshment. Overnight at the hotel in Cairo

Take a short 70 minute flight to Luxor to board your luxury Nile Cruise. After Lunch on board, visit the Luxor & Karnak Temples. Dinner and Overnight onboard on the West bank. The cruise offers a unique chance to visit picturesque local villages and idyllic islands. You will visit many unforgettable sites along the Nile River between Luxor and Aswan, sites that are unique to Dahabiyas which you won’t find on large cruises; such as Al-Ramadi Island where you can have dinner on the island then get entertained with a unique Rababa Egyptian show then have an overnight alongside the nature. Stay in refined deluxe cabin interiors that provide every facility for an ultimate luxury experience. There is a spacious sundeck with a jacuzzi, a comfortable lounge and a dining room, it also features free internet access and a bazzar.

After breakfast on board, visit the West Bank (Valley of the Kings, Hatshepsut temple and the Colossi of Memnon. Sail to Esna and Tea time on the Sun Deck. Lunch & Dinner during sailing, and overnight beside an Island.

Breakfast while crossing Esna Lock. Then sail to Edfu and Lunch during sailing. Visit the Temple of Edfu and sail to Al Ramady Island. Enjoy a private Island dinner along with an exclusive Egyptian Rabab a show.

Breakfast on board while sailing to Gebel El Silsila. Visit Kom Ombo Temple. The sail to el Sheikh Fadl Island and Lunch on board during sailing. Arrive to Hor Diab Island and have the experience of swimming in the purest and cleanest water of the Nile River. - Dinner during sailing and overnight beside Island.
Breakfast while sailing to Aswan. Then visit the Philae Temple and the High dam. Take lunch on board. Option to visit the Nubian Village in the afternoon. Dinner on board & overnight in Aswan.

After breakfast onboard, there is the option to visit Abu Simbel Temple early morning before disembarking in Aswan. Transfer to hotel for check in and refresh Afternoon, transfer to enjoy having lunch by a private felucca ride. Overnight at the hotel in Aswan.

Breakfast on board before checking out and being transferred to Aswan airport to fly back to Cairo. Arrive Cairo airport, meet a representative and transfer to your hotel for check in and refresh Overnight at the hotel in Cairo
Breakfast at the hotel, check out Transfer to Cairo airport for final departure.
